com.hypirion.io
Class Pipe

java.lang.Object
  com.hypirion.io.Pipe
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClosingPipe
public class Pipe
extends java.lang.Object

A Pipe is a link between an input stream and an output stream or a reader or writer: The pipe, once started, will asynchronously redirect all data received from the input source to the output source until it is paused, stopped or the input source is empty. Common usage of pipes includes asynchronous zipping of data from two data sources, redirecting output and input to subprocesses and for loggers you want to just pipe from and input source.

Since:
com.hypirion.io 0.2.0

out - the output stream to write out to.

Method Detail

join

public void join()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits for this pipe to finish piping. This happens when this pipe is stopped and the last blocking read has finished.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting.
See Also:
stop(), stop(boolean)

start

public void start()
Starts up this pipe. If this pipe has not yet been started or has been paused, this method will (re)start the pipe. When this pipe is stopped, this method will do nothing.

pause

public void pause()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Pauses this pipe. Will block until the current blocking read by this pipe has finished, regardless of whether this pipe has been stopped or not. If this pipe has already been paused or stopped, and there is no blocking read waiting, will immediatly return.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting.
See Also:
pause(boolean)

pause

public void pause(boolean block)
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Pauses this pipe. If block is true, will wait until the current blocking read by this pipe has finished. Will otherwise notify this pipe and return immediately.

Parameters:
block - whether to wait for the blocking read (if any) or not.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting.

stop

public void stop()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Stops this pipe. Will wait until the last blocking read has finished.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting.
See Also:
stop(boolean)

stop

public void stop(boolean block)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Stops this pipe. Will wait until the last blocking read has finished. If block is true, will wait until the current blocking read by this pipe has finished. Will otherwise notify this pipe and return immediately.

Parameters:
block - whether to wait for the blocking read (if any) or not.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting.
